JOESTRADAMUS ON THE SHORT & LONG RANGE

While the weather remains typical spring here with ups and downs from day to day, a major spring storm is bringing severe weather in the Plains and the Mississippi Valley from blizzard conditions in West Kansas to severe thunderstorms in the Central Gulf states. However a pattern shift is underway with blocking developing in the North Atlantic. This is going to create rainy cool conditions in the east later this week and that might last for awhile.

title: Long Island Temperatures 30 Degrees Lower Today

content:
JOESTRADAMUS ON BLOCKING..WHAT IS IT & WHAT DOES IT MEAN?

Think about the word block. It bascially means that something trying to get from point A to point B has to find another road to get there.Often times that detour is not a pleasant one. Such is the case in the atmosphere. When you have a block it changes the normal flow of systems from west to east. This can lead to all sorts of unusual weather outcomes.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/umE2Z0c-CTQ" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
name: Meteorologist Joe Cioffi
title: What Is Blocking?

content:
JOESTRADAMUS ON THE LONG RANGE..IF YOU LIKE IT COOL AND WET..YOU MAY GET YOUR WISH

EUROPEAN AND GFS MODEL SHOW STRONG BLOCKING OVER THE NORTH ATLANTIC DISPLACING THE JET STREAM WELL SOUTH FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.

All the weather models show a large blocking high building over Greenland displacing the jets stream well south of normal. This would favor a cold wet pattern overall for the next couple of weeks. The first rain threat comes late this week with the potential for a couple of inches of rain. Strong low pressure if forecast in the Eastern US. 

http://www.meteorologistjoecioffi.com/index.php/2017/04/30/long-range-cool-wet-first-half-may/

WHAT EXACTLY IS BLOCKING?

We have been talking about a strong spring blocking pattern setting up which is going to impact our weather for the next 10 days or so. But what exactly is it? This video explains that when highways moving traffic from west to east in normal flow occasional have to take a detour and occasionally traffic comes to a grinding halt.
